commit message: QuestionHelpFragent: Use margin sizes from the resources, not constants.
Remove an outdate comment.

DecisionTree: Optionally load a JSON file containing translations.

For instance:
https://github.com/zooniverse/Galaxy-Zoo/blob/master/public/locales/es.json

Singleton: Look for a translation (.json) file for the current locale.

And pass it to the DecisionTree.

Add the .json translation files from the Galaxy-Zoo web site.

These are from
https://github.com/zooniverse/Galaxy-Zoo/tree/master/public/locales
They are licensed under the Apache License 2
https://github.com/zooniverse/Galaxy-Zoo/blob/master/license.txt
Apache License 2 code may be used in GPL3 projects (like this one)
http://www.apache.org/licenses/GPL-compatibility.html
(but not the other way around)

These file can then be found by the Singleton constructor.
See the previous commit.

QuestionFragment: Correct getting the margin dimensions from dimens.xml.

R.dimens.* are IDs, not actual values, so we need to use Resources.getDimension().
QuestionHelpFragent: Use getDimensionPixelSize() to simplify code.
UiUtils: Remove unused getLocale() method.
Remove unnecessary imports.
Classify: Add 'Loadingâ€¦' text below the progress spinner.
Classify: Extra the progress view to progress.xml for reuse.
ExampleViewerFragment: Show the loading progress view while getting the image.

Rename icon files.

Use an ic_small_* prefix on the small/contextual icons.
These should be smaller than action icons:
http://developer.android.com/design/style/iconography.html
However, I cannot find any standard prefix for these icon names,
so I invented ic_small_*.

I have not yet changed the icon sizes.

List: Correct the small/contextual icons.

Move ic_small_accept.png, ic_small_favorite.png and ic_small_upload.png
from res/xhdpi/ to res/drawable-xxhdpi/ because xhdpi action icons
have the same pixel sizes as xxhdpi small/contextual icons:
http://www.creativefreedom.co.uk/icon-designers-blog/android-4-1-icon-size-guide-made-simple/

Generate the other sizes using the Anroid Asset Studio,
using Trim=Trim, Padding=0%, Size=12dip, Padding=2dip.
For instance:
http://romannurik.github.io/AndroidAssetStudio/icons-generic.html#source.type=clipart&source.space.trim=1&source.space.pad=0&source.clipart=res%2Fclipart%2Ficons%2Fav_upload.svg&size=12&padding=2&color=fff%2C100&name=ic_small_upload
Wide layout: Classify: Use the same progress layout part.
List: Add padding to left and right of small/contextual icons.
List: Hide the semi-transparent panel when it is empty.
Make a field private.
About dialog: Show the versionName from build.gradle.

Add Up navigation in (almost) all (non-main) activities.

We are meant to do this:
http://developer.android.com/training/implementing-navigation/ancestral.html

I don't know yet if/how we should do this with activities that could have
any of multiple parent activities, such as Settings.

BaseActivity.onOptionsItemSelected(): Handle up more generically.

This seems to be the recommended way (which also support earlier API targets)
and which should actually use the parent that is specified in the manifest.

Login, Settings: Add an Up icon that is like Back.

As suggested in
'Navigating to screens with multiple entry points' here:
http://developer.android.com/design/patterns/navigation.html
